Package com.tiyb.tev.controller

Class TEVStagingController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tiyb.tev.controller.TEVStagingController
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/staging-api")
public class TEVStagingController
extends Object
    This is the REST controller for working with items to be staged for eventual export. All APIs have the blog set, even in cases where it wouldn't technically be needed.
    Author:
    tiyb

      • exportImagesForBlogForPost

        @PostMapping("/posts/{blog}/{id}/exportImages")
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> exportImagesForBlogForPost​(@PathVariable("blog")
                                                                             String blog,
                                                                             @PathVariable("id")
                                                                             String postID,
                                                                             @RequestBody
                                                                             String pathForDestination)

        Exports images for a given post to an external directory.

        First calls fixPhotosForBlog() to ensure that the photos for the given post are already on disk, then copies them to the target directory. Because of this call to fixPhotosForPost(), there is no sanity check to ensure that the metadata's images directory is correct; that check is already done by the other method.

        If a file already exists, the method simply keeps on going to process further files; no error is thrown (though a warning is logged).

        Parameters:
        blog - Blog to which the post exists
        postID - The ID of the post for which images should be exported
        pathForDestination - The path to which the images should be copied
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity with the details
